questions.question: He crashed his car shortly after he ………………………. it.
questions.description: The past perfect is used for the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.question: I …………………….. my work before I went out to play.
questions.description: The simple past is also possible here, but the past perfect is considered more approrpriate.

questions.question: He ……………………… ill for about a month before he died.
questions.description: The past perfect is used for an action or situation that started at some point in the past and continued up to another point.

questions.question: The show ………………………… before we reached the venue.
No one took care of the children after their parents …………………………
questions.description: The simple past is also possible here but the past perfect is more appropriate.

questions.question: We ………………………….. here since
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: I ……………………… them for a long time.
Although the driver was badly hurt, he could explain what ……………………….
Neither of the boys ………………………….. arrived.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after neither.

questions.question: One of the students ………………………… missing.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after one of.
